P1arr_ym58t-TExEqgEMYw.text: This place reminds me of the Soup Kitchen aka 'Soup Nazi' in NY.  Not friendly but who cares when the food is spot on. Probably the best Indian food for the money.

M-KaRMmvBULVNYF2NYltcA.text: This is honestly my FAVORITE place to visit for food any time I visit London.  If you are ever in the Earl's Court area, Star Kebab House is THEE place to visit for take away food!!

QHysBYzdz9myRLfyXIGiwg.text: I found this place about 6 years ago when I was living in London. The Doner Kebab is the best I have ever had!!!!Everytime I visit London (I live in California) I come here at least once.....A Kebab is only about 4 quid.....and very delicious!

P7MQIGvwycM1hHgUT7uA3g.text: Was out late one night looking for food and was lured in here by the aromas of spices wafting out onto the sidewalk when I was living nearby over the summer.  They quickly became my usual place for late-night curry take away.

fY5JZZFjNSswRBHRS_ZTOw.text: One night I was very hungry and i was looking fior someething to eat and someone suggested that i try Star kebab, on the earls court road, it was the nicest takeaway curry I have ever had, excellent variety of different kinds of currys, open till late .. excellent prices, I trully recommend.

d_A3JRhv2XKSiy2C27bK1Q.text: My first introduction to Indian food was courtesy of Star Kebeb.  The food is out of this world, the owners and staff are very friendly (it didn't hurt that my travel partner spoke their Indian dilect).  In our four day stay, we ate at Star Kebab three nights in a row.  Last year was my first trip to London and in a trip full of highlights, Star Kebab was one of them.  My friend and I are returning to London (Earls Court) this September and Star Kebab will be one our first stops.

qHE7Vtqjr93Qsik5Bu4d0A.text: This is a nice take-away place to grab a quick bite to eat.  If you are on a tight budget go for the Falafel sandwich.  Their curries are pretty good and they make an alright mango lassi as well.

2q6oSdVo5KXvpQ7h0s1GNw.text: Wife and I were staying close by, visiting from the US. We had an amazing meal, and it was a pleasant surprise! There's not a ton of seating, but it smells amazing, and the food itself was excellent.We had the chicken tikka with rice, and the portions were large, with a hefty amount of meat. Really enjoyed the rich flavor, and the pleasant conversation. Don't overlook this spot, it was fantastic!

dUgui4i5sx92tn8De3Tg5w.text: One thing I liked about this place is that this is one of the few places that are open after bar hours.  There is also a pizza place that is open late only a few steps away from Star Kebab, but don't go there! It was disgusting!Even tho this is a Kebab place with Mediteranean food, there is also a variety of indian food like chicken tika masala, spinach paneer, and curry. I'm not sure eating Indian food after drinking was a best idea (don't do this if u are too drunk...) but the food was pretty decent.If I ever stay in the same area again when I visit London, this will definitely be my to go to place after drinking.

photos.caption: Photo of Star Kebab House - London, United Kingdom. Chicken Tika Masala and some veggie curry thing....

7_zEq6rBedM9auiVORqNBw.text: The place is a little cramped but the atmosphere and food more than made up for it. The food was delicious, I had the lamb curry with okra rice bowl and my boyfriend had the extra spicy chicken curry and rice. Plenty of flavor that's not masked by the spiciness. The owner gave us spoonfuls of the different dishes before we ordered so we knew what we were getting into. He and his staff were very friendly and introduced us to the other regulars. Unexpected but really cool.

Xax41_ce8c7FtbEHc5djjg.text: I went here while on vacation in London a few months ago. The day before I went here I went to an Indian place on Brick Lane (where all the curry houses are) in East London. Honestly, this place was just as good. AND, way cheaper. It was absolutely delicious and the owner even gave me a sample of multiple different foods. This guy works hard to master his recipes, and I could tell he was passionate about what he was doing. Don't follow the hype of Brick Lane. This place is great. Enjoy!

pWt-MqtjBMfa8AO746uLIw.text: Great affordable options here. We tried the small tikka, Satish kebab, and small doner. All were tasty & u can choose the sauce to mix in so many permutations & combinations to make ur delight!  All come w a healthy green portion of veggies in the sandwich & u can order side accompaniments too. All really tasty & fresh ingredients.

9RVb9cdABJVzB-mTiJL-bw.text: Very solid steam tray Indian and halal food. If you are looking for a quick bite at a decent price, you'd do well going here. The man behind the counter was very helpful and friendly, and very proud of his business and food.

9HuS8ZksGmG7n8J2k95FbA.text: What's up London? Just landed at Heathrow, and it was my first night every in London. Due to a hotel mixup in Zone 8/9, we got upgraded to a hotel in Earls Court. Of course, by the time we got to the hotel, everything in the area was closed, except Star Kebab House.Well, I'm starving... so I grab some money and head on over. They're out of the chicken doner...fine, I'll take the lamb. Oh, snaps, those curries look amazing. I'll take that one. "Are you sure? Its super spicy"Yeah man, just give it to me, I'm starving...Walk 5 minutes back to my hotel, open up some fragrant food...eat it up...wake up the next morning and stink up the whole room. Can't wait to come back to London.

Tuw-Po4lYba3CIZ4Ct4eZg.text: This is a bold statement, but here goes. Probably the best Doner Kebabs on the Planet! There I said it.I've been eating here for 20 years and now live in the states. You don't know what you miss until its gone and last week I flew 8000 miles, 2 tubes and a short walk to get here. I ate here both nights I was in town and it was culinary awesomeness. The lamb meat is very tasty the chilli sauce and salad were super  fresh and there is a taste nothing like it anywhere I've ever been to. If you like Indian food there is also a great take out or eat in selection. If the UK had Diners, drive-ins and Dives then then place should be on the show... Love it. Anthony Bourdain get your ass there.  If you're in London, Earls Court or Chelsea, then you will miss out big time if you don't stop in, ask for extra chilli sauce and tell them I sent you! :-)

DWqoVTDAfYBdVSk-obmM0Q.text: Very tasteful and convenient Kebab spot. The lamb and chicken kebab are great.  They prepare the food very quickly and offer three great sauces to top off your kebab; I like combing the chili sauce and the garlic mayo so that you get the kick from the chili but the easing from the mayo. They are also open quite late.

BmME1WI07LfRweYC8T2szA.text: Crazy good kebab. Top option near the Earls Court station. The smell wafting out the door is enough for a visit.

mbMPmnDoOc26CuLv1Goldw.text: Star Kebab is just a kebab shop in London. But it's the best I've found there in several trips. The food tastes fresh and delicious (no old oil or obviously frozen samosas). It's cheap, too: you can get more food than a person can eat for £10. It's also open until very late (5am on Saturday and Sunday), so it's always there when you get the munchies.I think it says a lot that, one the trip where I discovered Star Kebab, my GF and I ate there 3-4 times. And, on a subsequent trip, we took the tube from Marleybone to Earl's Court to eat there 3-4 more times.Amusing side story: I went there one night after hitting the pub. i asked for their spiciest curry; the guy behind the counter seemed reluctant, and asked me several times if I was sure. I said I was. Back in our hotel room, I took a bite, and OMG it was the spiciest thing I ever ate! I'm surprised that the curry didn't burn through the Styrofoam container! It was THAT hot!

egjXS3BlFjeWgm7RZApNOQ.text: Amazing Doner Kebab - it's the best I've had. I had it virtually every day during my recent visit to London, and never got tired of it. Haven't tried anything else here - no need.Why don't we have a place like this in the Mission in SF? It'd go over really well as an alternative to burritos and pupusas late night.

hMbs1MLyLU11H0F2Ut-6EA.text: I first discovered Star Kebab about 5 or 6 years ago when my friend suggested it at about 2 or 3am on a weekend after a late night of drinking.  The chicken doner is a favorite of mine, but my stomach just can't take the samosas and onion bhajis which are oozing with grease.  The curries are not bad, but there are better choices in the daytime and evening.Overall, its a good option for a late night snack in Earls Court.

ldGza7pMBpjo_jxR7pxToQ.text: the guys decided to come here for biryani at lunch time.there is a decent selection for curries here.we each ordered a bowl of biryani.for me i chose the mutton one.the rice was flavoured with the meat and the spices, cardamons and cloves being clearly visible.the mutton was surprisingly tender and rice fluffy.we shared some other dishes like spicy cauliflower and spinach with mutton.not much kick to the cauliflower nor the spinach.what i really objected to was the fact that they microwave their food before serving! luckily, they did not do so for the rice.i guess they do it to ensure you have a warm meal but i think there are healthier options for keeping your cooked food warm.microwaving changes the state of the food and inexplicably overcooks it.seating is limited to bar stools along one side of the shop.there was a steady flow of customers but mostly for takeaway.we decided to finish up with tea and that was a letdown.they basically used teabags and the finished product was a diluted version of what we are used to.the kebab looks rather lonely and did not look very promising.sorry but i think there are better options out there.kudos to the staff for skimming the oil from their curries every now and then.good for late nights.free delivery after 7pm for min order of 10 quid.they also cater for parties of up to 300 people.

photos.caption: Photo of Star Kebab House - London, United Kingdom. halal food
Photo of Star Kebab House - London, United Kingdom. mirrored interior to create illusion of space

KTKLo9NWBkSFnNegtU35jg.text: It is ghetto, yes. But oh so delicious,I would go back in a flash.

aB1ZNyDCoipIRJgjty5pIg.text: Very cheap, really delicious Indian food.  It's not a sit-down restaurant, it's a take-away place.  However, they do have stools and counter where people can eat. Great for a quick delicious lunch - or dinner, if you don't mind the simple setting.

kA13b7j_0D0hOzxqzzRWtA.text: Such great food, and amazing people who work there!  I did a study abroad and lived across the street from there for 3 months.  The guys who worked there would help us out when we spent all our money on Gin, and we would pay them in the morning on our way to class.  :)I miss that place!

AGp6eNhJxjmsb_xHi-zy4w.text: Best meat biryani outside of South Asia and Midwest!! The owners/server are also really welcoming.

Bz2OHMNsl00iXz6lOGe9uw.text: I've been looking for Doner ever since I visited Yarmouth, Canada and London is the only other place I've seen it.  This was great!  Delicious, smelled of garlic - just YUM.  Too much for one person though.  It was late and I was tired. I brought back to the hotel which I wouldn't do again - it was messy and smelled a lot.  Don't get take away, eat it in the shop.

-NTnL_-WUPKXi14orPxREQ.text: One of my fave places to eat in London, it is open super late and most of the food is fresh and tastes great. The curries are really good and authentic and  come in levels of spiciness. The doner is good but too much can make you feel queezy.

u7hVXvsa4w-xyIEVSIS7qw.text: Nice people in a nice restaurant. The lamb is so delicious! There are lots of choices.

ITvuA-MXZw6y2qWVgIjY2w.text: Friendly joint that is open late night. Staff is helpful.Chicken doner kebab was filling but not close to what you might find in Berlin. The vegetables seemed rather stale and be sauce wasn't well distributed.If you have a late night hankering this place is fine. Wouldn't go out of my way for.

qYsulXyMQTWrFjx7mrGP4g.text: My friends and I are living on LongRidge Road which is about a 2 minute walk from Star Kebab. Nearly all of them had been to the restaurant several times so I decided to try it out. My friend and I walked in at about 8pm and it was not hay crowded. Small building with a small seating area but expected in London. Very warm inside after the heat wave that was sweeping through the U.K. We both ordered the chicken kebabs which was in a tortilla like thing. You had the option of having a cole-slaw topping in it along with a choice of sauce. Pretty  good price but I suggest getting the larger portion since it is about 3 times bigger for only a small increase in price. We brought the food back home and it smelled great. Tasted great but about an hour after eating it we felt a little sick with stomach aches. Our other room mates had not had this side affect after eating Star Kabob the times they went. It was not extreme but still not a comfortable feeling. Besides the minor stomach ache after, it was very good with good portion sizes. The fries you can get are very good as well. Took a Tums after and felt fine. Will definitely go back since it is very close. Overall, another good restaurant with friendly staff in the Earl's Court area.

photos.caption: Photo of Star Kebab House - London, United Kingdom

2aMRFUVTDOdBaAkw_X-xpg.text: The dryest tasteless food I have ever eaten. Skip this place no run as fast as you can. Bla

Wj2tp2RmwzzfdRDVW4mUFg.text: This was such a pleasant surprise to encounter the first night in London. Close to the train line and open super late. The service was great and the food was AMAZING. Very good options and flavorful.Not a lot of room to eat so plan to stand or take it away. The flavor of the food was fresh and the options of sauces was great. I highly recommend this and the prices were unbeatable.

YwS-aeRtjSHr9ftfQqeTjQ.text: If you have ever read one of my reviews before you know that I have said that if I write a review while still eating my food it is either really good or really bad. This time... you guessed it....bad .. i was soo looking forward to my chicken shawarma. The first bit I took I actually liked but on the second... blaaa. The main issue was the freshness the chicken was old for sure. I also got pieces of tendon which I absolutely hate. I will say that the sauces were very good (sweet chili and garlic mayo). If the chicken wasn't soo bad, I know I would have enjoyed it.

Y0J6w_Uch-VGYEkWNlZWOA.text: Passed by here so many times it was always pretty busy and the staff is nice.Late night eating ? Spot to be lol

L119BwSzpr36SNVPEKCSMw.text: The flavors you smell wafting our the door of Star Kebab house are an exact representation of how delicious their rice and curries are. We tried spicy lamb, eggplant, and mild chicken and loved them all equally. The girl at the counter was very friendly and helpful. Take away is the best choice because the dining space is tiny and not especially ambient. I know when I return home I will be remembering Star Kebab and wishing it were close to my house!

Ygc1XfKL7wxP9iJewbF7kQ.text: My wife and I were walking by the restaurant headed for pizza and we did an about take when we caught the great aroma coming out of the door. Add in the kind service and that made our choice. And we were not disappointed. We had the chicken curry and it was amazing. Highly recommend this friendly spot.

BXHQyoAiwDK_4P2NaTGAXA.text: The food here is really good, the hours are great, but the customer service that we received from the owner was phenomenal! We accidentally left an important bag there and he was kind enough to hold it for us until we could return the following day. He is a Good Man who makes Good Food!

flBCVOQ9zZQ0ZSHBWymW9A.text: The food is amazing! I've tried a whole lot of Indian restaurants, always looking for one better than the last, and I have to say, this is definitely top 3 in my book. We had the biryani rice and chicken tikka masala. Don't be fooled by the abundant red paste in the masala. There is a lot of chicken underneath. The whole dish had a nice spicy kick. The rice was also flavorful. The gentleman that helped us was very friendly and helpful. If I'm ever in London again, I'll definitely be back!

FlgDI-BAA5BUrjEIqtFKFQ.text: Chose the #37 spicy lamb curry for dinner. Less than 8 £ and it was delicious. An explosion of flavors. Staff was super friendly. Best to take the meal to go as there is limited seating and it is extremely hot inside. If you enjoy curries, kebabs and other spicy foods, this restaurant in Earls Court is well worth visit.

zYhSRlCpqMzK---VmfE1mg.text: Some really delicious, pre-made Indian food. For my taste the seasoning, saltiness, and spiciness were just right. This little hole in the wall was a true delight.

xxLYxZrTeSbX0h9AA3phag.text: The falafel was the size of elephant's ball, and it was so moist and tasty (I'm not joking here).  Not a place for fancy pants, but you bet it will be finger licking good that won't cost much.

QSKtzm2dm-m_ZZ1ijK2Qjw.text: We were starving at midnight and this place craved our hunger!  I got the shawarma wrap and it was delicious!  My friend got the byriani and it was also delicious. The samosas were also delicious but a bit heavy in the pastry. Overall a wonderful meal!

_WkPbm21Fb3kea59MbEODw.text: My husband has been talking about this place for ten years. I finally made it here with the family. It is fantastic! I had a combination kebab in naan bread with garlic sauce. I ate every bite. The chicken tikka masala was so tender and flavorful it melted in my mouth. We are going back tonight. I can't wait

o_bmPLo252R1-ZalpNF1tw.text: HELLO TOURISTS!!! I don't understand why you keep coming here and giving it great reviews! This is NOT good indian food! Sorry but last time I went it was so dirty! I check the food hygeine rating and from the 4th of July 2016, it has been give a 1 on the hygeine scale!! That is ridiculously bad! Please save yourselves and just go to King's Kebab a bit more down the road, MUCH cleaner and the currys are delicious, a 5 on the official hygeine rating (Rating is from 0-5, 0 being the worst and 5 being the best) - although Im not too keen on the kebabs there but they are decent for a kebab shop.

B3bGi4iwb5P-PqC9dK4M7Q.text: Positives: -Close proximity to the Tube, my hostel, and other shopping venues.-Open late.-Quickly prepared.-I ordered Falafel in Pita. Very affordable (£5) and in generous quantities (I couldn't finish it!)-I recommend splitting if you have a smaller appetite. Makes it more affordable!Negatives:-Generally not friendly. Not sure why, but it made the atmosphere awkward.Overall, it fulfills its title! Good, cheap fast food to take on the go or to the nearest park. I will be returning during my stay here.

e6ZCju_QausOknMx7aiyyQ.text: Zahoor has been serving up the finest in slowly marinated spiced kebab meats in the same location, with the same menu, for more than 40 years. His secret: serving 100% meat, no filler, that's been slowly cooking in his family's sown blend of herbs and spices for hours until it's served up in a delicious fresh grilled pita or tandoori naan. I sampled the lamb doner and mixed kebab pita, because I just couldn't manage to eat only one! After sampling kebab all over the US, I can honestly say I've never eaten anything like this. Tender, juicy meat, delicious pita, fresh crunchy salad and of course topped with his very own spicy chili sauce to give it the kick it needs to finish perfectly. I also sampled his spicy lamb and chicken curries, that build heat the way a Hitchcock film builds tension: slowly, without avail, and always with a powerful ending. Zahoor himself is a man of the people, with several local folks dropping by just to say hello or introduce him to someone from out of town. And of course, Zahoor knows everyone by name and relevant details of their lives. The care and passion he pours into his food resonates deeply within the community, as his kebab house is a Kensington staple and one of the longest running in the area. We spoke at length about food, our background and never have I been made to feel at home the way I have here. This isn't a recommendation; it's a rite of passage. Be sure to stop by next time you're in Kensington or if you decide to make the trip. You'll be glad you did.

rrc78xWIEpBgQIeHrP9_bg.text: Every review on here is correct, absolutely perfect spot for a late night kebab. Docked a star because the falafel didn't set my world ablaze but everything else was great.
